Patut Ditiru Nih, Ada Bule Punguti Sampah di Pantai Sumba
06 Nov 2019, 08:14 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Bule punguti sampah di Pantai Mananga Aba, Sumba Barat Daya (Foto: Servulus Bobo Riti/Istimewa)

Sumba Barat Daya - Seorang bule di Indonesia mencuri perhatian. Sosok wisatawan perempuan itu terlihat memunguti sampah di Pantai Mananga Aba, Sumba Barat Daya.Turis asing ini tampak membersihkan sampah di lokasi seraya mengajak orang yang tertarik dengan kegiatannya itu untuk ikut serta."Karena mereka posisi keluar dari arah pantai pasir, maka saya tidak tahu persis apa yg dilakukan sebelumnya. Yang pasti saat sudah berada di pantai saya melihat banyak turis asing dan wisnus lagi menunggu sunset," kata Servulus Bobo Riti, Direktur Sosialisasi dan Kelembagaan BNP2TKI, pada detikcom, Selasa (5/11/2019)."Turis pungut sampah di Pantai Mananga Aba alias Pantai Kita Loura Sumba tanggal 3 November lalu," ucap dia menambahkan.


Foto: Servulus Bobo Riti/Istimewa

Kegiatan bule tersebut memang menarik perhatian Servulus yang serta-merta mengabadikannya. Ia pun diajak ikutan membersihkan sampah di Panta Mananga Aba."Pada Minggu sore tersebut, saya dan rekan kerja posisi ke pantai pasir dan saat itu si turis perempuan asik mungut sampah. Saya refleks ambil fotonya dengan meminta izin. Turis tersebut berkata 'it would be better if you can do it, too' saya katakan 'sure, thank you'," urai dia.Servulus mengatakan, hanya ada satu bule wanita dan dua temannya, yakni orang lokal dan sepertinya guide. Mereka bertiga-lah yang bebersih di Pantai Mananga Aba itu.Apa yang dilakukan bule ini dalam memunguti sampah tempat wisata jelas patut ditiru oleh siapa saja. Ini sekaligus mencerminkan bahwa walaupun memang ada turis nakal dalam liburannya ke Indonesia, dan bahkan sampai viral akibat tingkah-polahnya, yang berperilaku positif pun tetap ada.Menyoal pemandangan alam sendiri, Pulau Sumba atau tepatnya di Kabupaten Sumba Barat Daya, NTT memang punya daya tarik mengagumkan. Bukti otentiknya bisa dilihat di Pantai Mananga Aba. Pantai yang masih asri ini sayang sekali untuk dilewatkan.Oleh penduduk setempat, Pantai Mananga Aba disebut juga Pantai Kita. Lokasinya tidak jauh dari jalan raya dan hotel yang ada di sekitar sana. Dari jalan raya, hanya perlu waktu kurang dari 30 menit untuk bisa melihat birunya air laut dan pasir pantai yang kecoklatan.Di sepanjang perjalanan menuju pantai, yang terlihat hanya pemandangan hijau yang indah. Berbagai tanaman dikembangbiakkan di sini. Jalannya pun lumayan mulus, hanya sedikit ruas jalan yang rusak. Pesona pantai jelita ini tentu saja jadi kian rupawan ketika kebersihan di sana senantiasa terjaga.Simak Video "Menang Telak, Iwan Bule Ketua Umum PSSI 2019-2023"[Gambas:Video 20detik](msl/krs)

It should be imitated, there are foreigners collecting trash on the Sumba beach
Nov 6 2019, 08:14 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Caucasians collect garbage at Mananga Aba Beach, Southwest Sumba (Photo: Servulus Bobo Riti / Special)

Southwest Sumba - A foreigner in Indonesia steals the attention. The figure of the female tourist was seen picking up trash at Mananga Aba Beach, Southwest Sumba. This foreign tourist seemed to clean up trash at the location while inviting people who were interested in his activities to participate. "Because they were out of the direction of the sand beach, I don't know. exactly what was done before. To be sure when I was at the beach I saw many foreign tourists and tourists waiting for sunset, "said Servulus Bobo Riti, Director of Socialization and Institutionalization of BNP2TKI, on Tuesday (11/05/2019)." Tourists "Picking up trash at Mananga Beach Aba aka Kita Loura Sumba Beach on November 3," he added.


Photo: Servulus Bobo Riti / Special

The Caucasian activity indeed attracted the attention of Servulus, who immediately enshrined it. He was also invited to take part in cleaning up rubbish in Panta Mananga Aba. "That Sunday afternoon, my colleague and I were in a position to go to the sand beach and at that time the cool female tourist was trashy. I reflexively took a picture with permission. better if you can do it, too 'I say' sure, thank you ', "he explained. Sergeant said, there was only one Caucasian woman and two of her friends, namely local people and seemed to be guides. The three of them were the cleanest ones in Mananga Aba Beach. What this Caucasian man did in picking up trash in tourist attractions is definitely worth emulating by anyone. This also reflects that although there are indeed naughty tourists on their holidays to Indonesia, and even viral due to their behavior, positive behavior also persists. Questioning the natural landscape itself, Sumba Island or precisely in Southwest Sumba Regency, NTT does have an appeal awesome. The authentic proof can be seen at Mananga Aba Beach. This beautiful beach is too bad to be missed. By the locals, Mananga Aba Beach is also called Kita Beach. The location is not far from the highway and hotels around there. From the highway, it only takes less than 30 minutes to be able to see the blue sea water and brownish beach sand. Along the way to the beach, which looks only beautiful green scenery. Various plants are bred here. The road was pretty smooth, only a few damaged roads. The charm of this beautiful beach, of course, becomes more beautiful when cleanliness is always maintained.
